result.execSummary:
The defendant Deborah S Sinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Use/Child to Manuf/Distribute Drug [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.455(1).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 2. Conditions of probation are the same as conditions of extended supervision.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. No contact with minors without approval of Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Submit DNA sample.
Obtain AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, receipt of PSI, recommendation contained therein.  State/Defense make sentencing recommendations (not joint). Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 2, 5. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2, 5. Counts 3, 4 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Parties are requesting PSI. Court orders PSI. Bond continues as is.
Pre-trial conference at 12-22-2015 01:30 pm
Jury trial at 01-13-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests that case be set for trial and pretrial, mostly in order to get case to move forward. Set for trial and pre-trial.

Court thinks case should be placed on trial docket. Defense advises of offer. State agrees that Defense has not spoken with ADA Korb yet.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of trouble connecting with Defendant, advises that progress is being made, requests status/possible plea in 30 days. If not resolved at next hearing, case will have to be put on trial docket.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requests 30-45 days to complete discovery review with Defendant.  Status conference scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Deborah S Sinn in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity. Defense requests status, has a lot of discovery to review. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Status conferense set for May 18, 2015 at 10:00. Bond continues as is.

Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.
